frameDefinitions: A Protagonist has (or does not have) a Weapon.
A Rider is being transported in a Vehicle, or is moving on foot.
The Lender gives the Theme to the Borrower with the expectation that the Borrower will return the Theme to the Lender after a Duration of time.
An Item is attached by a Handle, via a Connector, to a Goal, or Items are attached to each other.
A Material has been processed (generally industrially) to some Degree in order to make it more useful for some (usually implicit) function.
The words in this frame refer to what Clothing the Wearer (or a specific Body_part of the Wearer) has on.
frameExamples: Apparently, the suspect is <t>armed</t> with a shotgun.
<t>Mounted</t> police officers are a common sight in this village.
I am <t>lending</t> a student of mine my book on German modal particles.
My thumb was <t>stuck</t> to the tube of glue.
I <t>had</t> <t>on</t> the most ridiculous monkey-suit you could imagine.
listRoleDefinitions: The destructive device that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> has with them.
The time at which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> carries a <fen>Weapon</fen>.
The location where a <fen>Protagonist</fen> carries a <fen>Weapon</fen>.
The <fen>Rider</fen> is being transported by a <fen>Vehicle</fen>.
The person or institution who receives the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The person or institution who gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The object that is transferred from the <fen>Lender</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The time when the lending event occurs.
The location in which the Lender lends the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen>.
<fen>Connector</fen> identifies the instrument used to attach and is usually expressed in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.
<fen>Item</fen> identifies the entity that comes to be attached to the <fen>Goal</fen>.
<fen>Items</fen> identifies the plural items that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment.
<fen>Goal</fen> identifies the location to which the <fen>Item</fen>(s) is attached.
The substance which is altered in some useful way.
The person whose clothing is under discussion.
This role identifies the <fen>Clothing</fen> that the <fen>Wearer</fen> wears.
The body part of the <fen>Wearer</fen> which is covered by the <fen>Clothing</fen>.
The time at or during which the <fen>Wearer</fen> has the <fen>Clothing</fen> on.
listRoleExamples: I lent the book <fex>to him</fex> for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.
<fex>I</fex> lent the book to him for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.
I lent <fex>the book</fex> to him for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.
I lent him my car <fex>on Friday</fex>.
I lent him my book <fex>in Dubai</fex>.
The tarp is  tied down <fex>with a rope</fex>.
<fex>A handle</fex>  was affixed to the door.
The boat remained anchored <fex>to the coastline</fex>.
She was wearing a glove <fex>on one hand</fex>.
<fex>By five o'clock</fex>, he was wearing the old holey jeans and t-shirt again.

passageCandidateSpans.text: Bloody Century: Genocide and Mass Murder Since 1900 Transaction Publishers
